llm.feedback: The draft is on the right track but can be tightened to meet the “elite bar” and the 0‑3‑week horizon requirement. 1) **Trim excess narrative** – keep only the key points: current S&P 500 level (≈6,460), 10‑year yield (4.23%), Fed’s September meeting, tariff expiration (mid‑Oct), and core PCE (2.6%). 2) **Add explicit causal chain** – e.g., “Fed’s dovish tone → 89 % cut odds → S&P 500 could lift to 6,500–6,600” and “Tariff policy → higher import costs → tech‑sector drag → S&P 500 pressure.” 3) **State magnitude ranges** – 25‑bp cut, 4.23% yield, 6,500 threshold, 6,400 downside. 4) **List catalysts and invalidations** – catalysts: Fed meeting (Sept 16‑17), tariff expiry (mid‑Oct), PCE data (July). Invalidation: PCE > 2.6%, tariff hike, 10‑year > 4.3%. 5) **Add monitoring items** – Fed minutes, yield curve steepening, tariff policy updates. 6) **Ensure inline citations** – attach (97MD1FHW8), (U21K4ALYQ), (1DEM6P1Y2), (3YAQ8JUPL) to each claim. 7) **Remove any drift** – eliminate references to other assets or unrelated commentary. After these edits, the note will be concise, actionable, and fully compliant with the guidelines.
